title: Cabin crew filmed entertaining passengers with sensual rendition of traditional Peruvian dance
title_page: Cabin crew filmed entertaining passengers with sensual rendition of traditional Peruvian dance | Daily Mail Online
text:
This is the moment airline passengers were given some special entertainment mid-flight when the flight crew broke into traditional Peruvian dance.
The video, recorded during a flight from Lima to Trujillo, was soon uploaded onto social media platforms.
Airline staff first gave out handkerchiefs and hats to those travelling on board before they turned on the music and the dancers, in traditional dress, positioned themselves in the aisles.
Airline passengers were given some special entertainment mid-flight when the flight crew broke into traditional Peruvian dance
This passenger was keen to join in with the flight crew, taking a white handkerchief and showing some moves
Many of the passengers also jumped up from their seats to dance along with the air hostesses and hosts, who can be seen twirling their white handkerchiefs from side to side.
The dance in question is a coastal dance of Peru called Marinera, where the man traditionally wears shoes while the woman dances completely barefoot.
Marinera is a graceful and romantic couple's dance that uses handkerchiefs as props. The dance is an elegant and stylised re-enactment of a courtship, and it shows a blend of the different cultures of Peru.

With a lot of practice, women are able to dance barefoot on extremely hot pavements and very rough surfaces, as the soles of their feet get toughened up, something they are really proud of.
This week the 56th national Marinera contest was held in Peru.
It saw 1,600 couples compete for the prize of best dancers.
